data.name: Count Max Tries
data.description:
**Count Max Tries**
-------------------
An introduction into the binary search algorithm is achieved by programming the game "Find The Number". The most frequent alternative of the game demands from the student to programm a game where a human or a computer player (primitive AI) must guess a random integer in the range of integers \[0, 100] (bounds inclusive) using as less tries as possible. 
For the range of 100 numbers the player or the AI making the wisest selections will need no more than 7 tries to find the secret number. This demands to use the binary search algorithm. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Binary_search_algorithm
Challenge
---------
In the case where a left bound and a right bound are given; what will be the maximum number of tries a wise player will need to find a random integer out of a range of integers made from these bounds? 

The function will have two parameters: left bound and right bound and must return an integer which will be the tries to find a secret integer in this range. 

Limitations
-----------
`lbound >=0` and `rbound >=1` and `rbound >= lbound` and `rbound < 239e306`.

A representative difference between `rbound` and `lbound` in the advanced cases can be:
``

Examples
---------

\>>> max_tries(lbound=1, rbound=100)
- out:  7 

\>>> max_tries(1, 128)
- out: 7

\>>> max_tries(1, 129)
- out: 8
